Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About Royaltyport:

Royaltyport assists artists and their managers in managing their music business intelligently. Our mission is to ensure artists understand their rights and income, receiving fair compensation. Founded by seasoned entrepreneurs with extensive music industry expertise, Royaltyport has recently launched its product and is already collaborating with artists like Sam Feldt, Purple Disco Machine, Oliver Heldens, and John Newman.




About You:

We’re looking for a passionate data analyst intern to join our team. You’ll collaborate closely with seasoned startup founders, experienced engineers, and our expert data lead.




Musicians receive revenue reports in various formats and from multiple sources. Your role will involve identifying errors in the data and visualising it in a way that is clear and actionable for our artists. This could involve areas of underpayment, errors in royalty calculations, or missing payments altogether. You will focus on both novel and common reporting errors in the industry. Additionally, you will become an expert on different types of royalties and develop expertise in musical earnings over the course of your internship.




We’re seeking someone who learns quickly and is eager to dive in and make a meaningful impact. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and want to play a role in a changing industry, we’d love to hear from you.




Requirements:

Must-Have:
Students pursuing an academic university degree or recent graduates in econometrics, data science, statistics, or computer/information sciences.
Strong knowledge of SQL.
Strong analytical capabilities.
Eligibility to work in the Netherlands.
Bonus Points For:
Experience with Looker Studio or visualisation platforms like PowerBi or Tableau.
Experience in Python.
Any analytical work experience.
Any kind of pre existing knowledge on music royalties.




Our Ideal Candidate:

Believes in our mission.
Able to work independently.
Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Is available at least 3 days a week, and can frequently come to our office in Amsterdam.
Is available for at least 4 months.
Passion for music and the music industry is a plus, though not required.
Proficiency in Dutch is a plus, though not required.




What We Offer:

An opportunity to work in the music industry and gain a unique peek behind the curtain.
An internship allowance of €500,-.
Learn for experienced data professionals and startup founders.




What’s next:

If you’re excited about this opportunity, send your information to hello@royaltyport.com. Sharing previous work, if applicable, is highly encouraged. The first step is an initial online meeting. We might ask you to do a technical test, depending on your level of experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this Data Analyst role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven strategies by analyzing complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through data-driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Database Optimization: Design and maintain scalable database structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform data from multiple sources.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Data Analysis: Work with payment gateway data (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet data needs.
Compliance: Ensure data handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw data into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a data-driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
Experience with Looker Studio, BigQuery, and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Are you passionate about energy, sustainability, and technology, with a strong drive to leverage data for impactful solutions?

Flexcity, a leading European energy tech company within the Veolia Group is looking for a resourceful Data scientist Heat to join our team.

This position offers the opportunity to join the Flexcity Portfolio Management team in Amsterdam , alongside a team of skilled colleagues from different backgrounds, within the company headquarters in Brussels.

Historically, heat-intensive industries have relied on natural gas to produce steam and hot water. As these sectors move toward decarbonisation, they must adopt alternative methods for generating industrial heat. We believe Power-to-Heat technologies—such as electric boilers (eboilers), heat pumps, and thermal storage—will be essential in driving this transition.

Job Description

Role

As the Data Analystfor Flexcity Netherlands, you will:


Design, develop, and maintain scalable database solutions
Create and optimize complex SQL queries and stored procedures
Implement data models and database designs to support business requirements
Develop and maintain ETL processes and data pipelines
Ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity across all database systems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide solutions
Implement database security measures and backup/recovery procedures
Monitor database performance and troubleshoot issues as they arise
Stay current with emerging database technologies and best practices


Analysis of Data is a crucial responsibility at Flexcity, as Data Analyst closely work together with our Portfolio team and our Data team in Brussels and our R&D team in Caen.

The responsibilities of the Data Analyst include:


Project Management 40%
Develop and maintain data pipelines, putting in place a clear documentation to support the pipelines
Take a strong role in carrying out data quality checks and reporting


Operations 40%
Write SQL queries on various data sources
Maintain a SQL database and manage all its dependencies and connections


Strategy 20%
Analyze and translate business needs to systems and processes;
Develop and implement feasible solutions to satisfy these needs
Qualifications

Key Qualifications

Hard Skills


Fluent in English, with other languages considered as a plus: Dutch and/or French
Experience as a Database Analyst or Data Engineer
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle)
Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies
Familiarity with ETL tools and processes
Knowledge of data modeling techniques and database design principles
Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Java, Scala)


Soft Skills


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
Flexible, not afraid to think outside the box
Spirit of sharing your knowledge
Results-oriented with a pragmatic and professional attitude


Additional Information

Why Join Flexcity?

Impact You will have a direct impact on the energy transition

Scale-up Work in an agile environment, getting structured and more efficient, but still with a large freedom and strategic decision-making available at all levels of the company

Group Benefit from a close relationship with the Veolia group, a global leader in the ecological and energy transformation

Innovation Engage with cutting-edge energy technology and markets

Stimulating You are surrounded by talented people with a wide variety of skills and real experts in the field of energy and technology

International Engage with a team spread across multiple countries, learning and innovating together. Connect with diverse teams across Europe through regular team-building events, both within Flexcity and Veolia

Training Develop your hard and soft skills with dedicated training made available, as well as strong learning curve within your position

Hybrid Experience international collaboration and flexible work schedules, including 2 work-from-home days

As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

Als Business Data Analyst analyseer je complexe datasets, bouw je datagedreven oplossingen en adviseer je klanten bij strategische beslissingen. Je vertaalt bedrijfsdoelen naar bruikbare data-oplossingen en creëert inzichten via dashboards en rapportages.

Marktconform salaris en 190 vakantie-uren.
Pensioenregeling en flexibele werktijden.

Innovatieve werkomgeving gericht op persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Je bent analytisch, proactief en hebt een passie voor data. Je hebt ervaring met Power BI of Tableau, geavanceerde SQL-kennis, en bent bekend met datawarehousing en ETL-processen. Title: [4893] Data Analysis and Reporting
Description:
Start date: April 2025

Clearance: NATO Secret

Location: The Hague

Effective business performance tracking ensures NDWC has clear visibility and control in the execution of its strategic objectives and covers business topics such as: financial health, resource allocation, cost management and other quantitative business assessments. Budget analysis and monitoring
Cost management and tracking
Resource management and optimization



Product Portfolio Monitoring and Control:

The scope of user stories will cover, amongst others, the following areas:


SLA (Service Level Agreement) tracking and reporting
Project performance tracking and reporting
Service performance tracking and reporting
Resource leveling and utilization



Maintenance and Quality Control:

Maintenance and quality control underpin the reliability, availability and accessibility of data and reporting outputs. It ensures accurate insights and adaptability to changing business needs, thereby supporting effective monitoring and control of both the business performance and the product portfolio. The scope of user stories will cover, amongst others, the following areas:


Creation and delivery of repeatable and automated reporting outputs
Execution of repeatable technical tasks (e.g., data model maintenance, data refreshes)
Addressing repeatable data-driven tasks (e.g., follow-up on data quality issues)
Managing user access and control
Conducting user training
Implementing incremental improvements
Developing automated data quality checks

Title: Data Science and Analytics Graduate
Description:
Data Science & Analytics Graduate

About Booking.com

Do you dream of a world where travel is effortless and personalised? At Booking.com, we're making that dream a reality. For over 20 years, we've been revolutionising the travel industry, starting with online hotel bookings. Today, we're building a one-stop platform that encompasses flights, taxis, rental cars, tours, and more, creating a flawless travel experience.

By booking dream flights to exotic destinations, streamlining airport transfers with convenient taxis, enabling exploration through car rentals, and providing tickets to must-see attractions, we help travellers unlock unforgettable experiences.

We're not just about booking hotels anymore; we're crafting personalised journeys that go beyond expectations. Join a team of passionate individuals who grow with challenges and embrace change, seeing every obstacle as an opportunity to innovate and improve the travel experience for everyone. Through our products, partners, and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

About The Programme

Calling all data-driven graduates! Booking.com's 12-month Data Science and Analytics Graduate Programme is your launchpad to a fulfilling career. We welcome applicants from any background (outside of Tech), as long as you have a passion for using real-world data to solve problems. Gain hands-on experience through real projects and learn from expert mentors who will guide you as you build your skills and make a lasting impact on the travel industry

Apply to the Booking.com DS&A Graduate Programme today!

Shape the future of travel through data

You'll play a pivotal role in crafting unforgettable travel experiences. By harnessing the power of data, you'll transform how travellers plan their adventures.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with multi-functional teams to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions that enhance the traveller's journey.
Oversee data analytics projects from inception to completion, ensuring timely delivery of actionable insights.
Stay at the forefront of data analytics trends and technologies to drive innovation.
Develop and maintain data analytics standards, ensuring data quality, governance, and reporting accuracy.
Build and manage data pipelines, redefining raw data into actionable insights.
Create clear and comprehensive documentation for data-related processes and findings.



To succeed in this role, you'll need:


A bachelor's or master's degree in different fields than Data science or analytics, with a graduation date of either 2024 or 2025 from a Dutch University. This programme is specifically aimed at graduates who do not meet the academic requirements for our entry-level roles.
An interest in data and analytics, mathematics, statistics, or programming, demonstrated through academic achievements or personal projects.
Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication abilities.
A genuine passion for travel and curiosity in technology.
The ability to thrive in a multifaceted and fast-paced environment.



Important reminder:

This role is specifically designed for graduates who may not meet the traditional academic requirements for a data analyst position.

Live, work, and thrive in Amsterdam.


Modern office: Enjoy your workday in a brand new, centrally located Amsterdam office.
Award-winning culture: Join a team recognised for Best Leadership and Global Culture (2023).
Significant work, real impact: Take on exciting projects that make a difference in the travel industry.
Continuous learning: Develop your technical, behavioural, and interpersonal skills through on-the-job experience, innovative projects, hackathons, conferences, and community involvement.
Generous time off: recharge with 29 days of paid vacation plus bank holidays.



Important note about eligibility

In order to be eligible for this programme, you need to:


Graduate in 2025 or have graduated in 2024 from a different fields than Data science or analytics degree from a Dutch University.
Be available to start a full-time position for our 12-month programme in mid-September 2025.
Be able to commute to our office in Amsterdam.



Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Do you want to play a key role as a BI Analyst within a leading manufacturer? Our client is a global market leading manufacturer where you will have the opportunity to build BI reporting and analysis from the ground up. Your work will ensure that crucial data on aspects such as inbound and outbound equipment, repair costs, and warranty conditions is structured and accessible, enabling better decision-making.




Your Role

As a BI Analyst, you will work closely with technical teams and act as a bridge between operations and data analytics. Your mission is to transform data into valuable insights that help improve processes and drive strategic decisions.




Currently, many reports are still created in Excel, but it’s time to take BI reporting to the next level in Power BI. You will be responsible for laying the foundation for a structured BI environment and ensuring dashboards and reports are not only developed but also effectively utilized.




What will you do?

Develop and implement BI reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Analyze and visualize data related to key operational processes, such as: inbound and outbound equipment, repair and replacement costs, warranty tracking and quality reporting.
Collaborate with technical and operational teams to deliver data-driven insights.
Lead the transition from Excel-based reporting to a more structured BI environment.
Identify and report on quality issues and operational improvement opportunities.




Who are you?

4+ years of experience with developing BI dashboards.
Extensive knowledge of PowerBI is a must
ERP knowledge is a strong plus.
A strong communicator and connector between technical and non-technical teams.
Experience working in an operational environment where data plays a crucial role.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
Fluent in English; Dutch is a plus but not a requirement.




What do we offer?

A challenging role in a globally leading company.
Lots of room for initiative and setting up a BI structure.
Salary up to 74K per year.
Great benefits.




Interested?

Would you like to contribute to the digitalization and optimization of BI processes at our client? Apply now and help shape the future of Technology.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol’s ambitions – and this is where you’ll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers.

Marketing Analytics play an instrumental role here. Our goal is to enable ‘Engagement at Scale’. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you’ll analyze our advertising partners’ behavior, uncover opportunities for improvement and share actionable insights with our marketeers so that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time. In all your decisions, you’ll take scalability into account as we serve thousands of active advertisers at any given moment.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we’re implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that the underlying data of our campaigns is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You’ll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You’ll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol’s Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas


You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand advertiser behavior, help optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of building and optimizing campaigns that help and engage advertisers
You help build, maintain and simplify our data model that supports our communication flows. All with the goal of enabling scalable campaigning where we reach thousands of advertisers at a relevant moment
You analyze the performance of our campaigns and attribute their commercial value. All with the goal of identifying opportunities for improvement and getting a clear picture of the impact we’re making as a department


We’re Looking For You If You


Don’t want to work alone. You work closely with various stakeholders to make the above possible. This requires strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers;
Challenge ideas. You help the team with the other Marketing data analysts to reach a higher level, both in terms of content and on a personal level.
Help implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards;
Help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol’s wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale;
Practice and preach Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise;
Know a thing or two about data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering and know your way around a marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage).


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


Uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you’ll need to navigate it confidently, so an entrepreneurial mindset is a must. Bol is complex, you have to involve and convince both Product & Tech colleagues to find solutions, proactively and autonomously.
Output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a dashboard – who cares how users experience it – then this job is not for you. We’re looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns!
No continuous improvement We’re always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
Sharing is caring You have hands-on experience in marketing analytics, SQL (e.g. BigQuery), statistics (the basics) and feel comfortable navigating and analyzing large, complex datasets.
High quality code results in clear and actionable insights Finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles make you smile and SQL, Git and dashboarding tools like Tableau/Looker Studio are your home away from home. *Dbt and/or Airflow is a plus.
You are not a one-trick-pony Our role is multi-faceted so you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building blocks. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.


This is where you’ll work

You’ll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our multidisciplinary Avb Marketing team. Your marketing colleagues are seasoned in the world of data and CRM. Sparring happens on a daily basis. We like to make each other better – motivating and respecting are second nature to us.

Besides the strategic topics, you have the space to work on your own innovations and seize the opportunities you identify. Bol gladly invests in your personal and professional growth; development is a primary employment condition. The culture is informal, down-to-earth, and pioneering.

We work in collaborative spaces where you’ll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

They rely on us to provide them with meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep investing effectively

You’ll join 15 analysts in Bol’s advertising analytics organization. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst who is equally comfortable working with data as engaging with stakeholders. You’ll work with stakeholders to identify high value use cases for analytics, use SQL, Python, Dbt, and Tableau to then create metrics, do analysis across petabytes of data, make meaningful predictions, to eventually help advertising customers make better decisions. Your work will be input for amongst others client meetings, white papers, webinars, and public industry appearances.


You work closely with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing) and top advertising and agency customers to identify high value applications of analytics.

Title: Data and AI Analyst
Description:
About Anthos

The Anthos Family Office is the family office of the Brenninkmeijer family and is part of the COFRA group based across the globe. We’re a family business, geared to creating lasting value and united by an ambition to change industries and society for the better. Aspiration and entrepreneurism are encouraged and rewarded with opportunity. Teams are diverse yet close-knit. Relationships matter. People matter.




Every day, we’re working to amaze our customers and be a force for good, by advancing the success of the Sneekerkring’s endeavours and the flourishing of the Brenninkmeijer family community, by providing trustworthy advice and exemplary tailored services.




We are a professional services organisation that goes the extra mile to support our family member clients, and one another. We are able to create space for people who want to really excel in their areas of expertise. And who want to work with other professionals in a true team spirit.




About the Role

A new position has been created within our Anthos Data Management team to play a key role in delivering on our Vision 2030 business strategy. Specifically, our business strategy focuses on the ever-increasing quality of our core Anthos services and offerings to our clients, and this role will be instrumental to contribute to this by implementing specific changes in the delivery of these services by the use of AI and the effective working with data.




As part of the role, you will have the opportunity to work directly with team members from diverse professional disciplines, such as legal, tax and investments. The role offers variety and the chance to learn and make a positive impact on how we deliver our legal (notary and estate planning), tax and investment advisory and financial planning, especially as we pursue to maintain creating value over family generations and underpin our sustainability goals for now and the future.




The role is located in Amsterdam, The Netherlands and reports to the Senior Data Management Specialist.




Responsibilities

Data and Data Analytics

Proactively manage and coordinate complex data (e.g. investment portfolio data, holdings data, sustainability data, exposures, client data), deriving from multiple sources, to underpin our Vision 2030 and to enhance the core professional services offering, while ensuring we deliver on our client promises
Work together with data architects and data engineers to arrange well-functioning data interfaces, seamless data integration and to unlock data to a unified schema
Work with data domain owners to protect the data integrity, as well as to ensure alignment and progress towards business objectives (including creating value for clients and employees)
Support the data stewards with frameworks and tools to ensure data quality standards are met
Analyze and prepare data to be used in our internal reporting channels and towards our clients
Setup reports to visualize insights to help make decisions
Stay connected and aligned with the other data teams across the enterprise to continuously optimize data processes
Work with stakeholders to develop data-driven solutions




AI adoption

Drive the successful adoption of AI across Anthos’ core services, which include legal advisory, tax advisory, notarial and estate execution services and private wealth management
Contribute to integrating AI models into existing systems and workflows
Ensure smooth AI deployment and monitor the performance of AI solutions
Provide training and support to colleagues on how to use AI tools and interpret AI driven insights




Change management (culture and awareness)

Promote a data-driven culture in the organization
Remain up-to-date with industry trends and technological advancements
Act as knowledge-centre for the business in the area of data & AI




Requirements

Bachelor and/or master degree in field such as Computer Science, (applied) Mathematics, or another field with high exposure to data analytics
Preferably 1-3 years’ work experience in data management in a legal or tax advisory, or in an investments environment (also open to other professional services firms)
Experience with the following tools and concepts:
-Good understanding/ appreciation of data management frameworks
-BI tooling such as Power BI (preferred), Tableau etc.
-Proficient in SQL / Excel macros, Power Query/Pivot (M/DAX)
-Programming language to work with data i.e. Python, R, SQL
-Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Azure AI/ ML tooling
Experience in delivering relevant projects and demonstrates robust project management
Communication skills and fluency in business-level English
Ability to effectively collaborate with other teams and build strong working relations , as well as to combine business and IT/Technology needs
Flexible and able to adapt to changing priorities
Self-organised and structured, with ability to work independently and remotely on assigned projects
Can do mindset, pro-active, highly motivated and eager to learn
Accuracy and quality oriented
Unquestionable personal code of ethics and integrity
High sensitivity for data privacy being a key consideration of the work
Valid EU working permit




What is in it for you

Market conform salary and pension plan with self-contribution rate of only 1.4%
Hybrid way of working and flexible working hours
Contribution to set-up your home office
Monthly commuting allowance
31 days of holidays with possibility to buy and sell leave
Possibility to participate in group health insurance
Contribution to sports activities, bicycle, lunch and clothing discount at C&A
Training and development opportunities
Tools and resources for your wellbeing
Laptop and iPhone
Green café with barista and regular Thursday afternoon drinks




If you fit the profile and are interested in doing good while doing business, we would love to hear from you




Anthos is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on age, race, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin or disability. None of this gets in the way of hiring and retaining the best people.




*Background screening is a part of the recruitment process

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.









Job Description



Who will you be working with?
The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.



What you are going to do
As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.



Responsibilities include:



Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are



You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need



Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer



Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

De klantbeleving staat dan ook centraal en Jumbo is continu bezig om dit te verbeteren. Daarbij is het noodzakelijk om met behulp van de beschikbare data inzicht te hebben in de performance van de winkels en Jumbo.nl. Om dit te realiseren is er behoefte aan een gedreven Data Analist


Als Data Analist heb je veel afstemming met je collega’s en vorm je de spil tussen data, processen en besluitvorming. Je zal veel werken met Anaplan, een cloud-based planningstool die wordt gebruikt voor enterprise performance management (EPM) en geïntegreerde bedrijfsplanning (Integrated Business Planning, IBP). Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, analyseren en optimaliseren van Anaplan modellen en dashboards. Door middel van data analyse en modellering draag je bij aan de strategische besluitvorming van Jumbo en help je verschillende teams, zoals finance, sales en supply chain om beter te plannen en te forecasten. Je bent onderdeel van het team Financial Planning & Analysis Controlling (FP&A), onderdeel van de afdeling Group Finance.


Verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Het ontwerpen, analyseren en optimaliseren van modellen en dashboards;
  • Optimaliseren van bestaande Anaplan-processen en implementeren van nieuwe functionaliteiten.
  • Ondersteunen van stakeholders bij het gebruik van Anaplan-dashboards en rapportages.
  • Samenwerken met interne afdelingen (finance, sales, supply chain) om hun behoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar datagedreven oplossingen.
  • Bewaken van de datakwaliteit en zorgen voor nauwkeurige, realtime data-integratie met andere systemen (zoals ERP en/of CRM).


Profiel:

  • Een afgeronde, revelante Bachelor/Master opleiding (bijvoorbeeld Data Science, Bedrijfskunde, Finance of IT).
  • Minimaal 2-5 jaar relevante werkervaring;
  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden en ervaring met datamodellering- en analyse;
  • Ervaring met Anaplan of andere planningstools is gewenst (bijv. SAP Analytics Cloud, Cube, Onestream of Workday);
  • Kennis van databases of programmeertalen (bijv. SQL, Python) is gewenst;
  • Kennis van MS Power BI en/of MS Azure is gewenst;
  • Een proactieve houding en de drive om processen continu te verbeteren.


Aanbod:

  • Een uitdagende functie met volop doorgroeimogelijkheden in een informele organisatie met een zeer prettige werksfeer;
  • Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden, salarisindicatie EUR 4500,- tot EUR 6500,- per maand, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring;
  • Een contract voor 32-40 uur per week met de mogelijkheid om hybride te werken;
  • 30 vakantiedagen (met de mogelijkheid tot aan- of verkoop van vakantiedagen) en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Een jaarlijkse bonus van max 7,5% van je jaarsalaris op basis van organisatie-doelstellingen;
  • Collectieve pensioenregeling (Bedrijfstakpensioenfonds voor het Levensmiddelenbedrijf);
  • Een tegemoetkoming in je reiskosten (€ 0,21 cent per kilometer met een max. van 35 kilometer enkele reis);
  • Ruimte voor ondernemerschap, groei en ontwikkeling. Niet alleen in je werkzaamheden maar ook via de Jumbo Academy, online trainingen via GoodHabitz en met een opleidingsbudget;
  • Een (di)verse lunch in het Foodcafé, goede koffie en vers fruit. Tegen een kleine vergoeding sport je in de Jumbo Gym;
  • Diverse collega kortingen, zoals 10% korting op je boodschappen (max. €325,- per jaar) en deelname aan de collectieve zorgverzekering.

Title: Power BI Consultant
HTML:
Your role as a Power BI Consultant


As a Power BI Consultant, you advise our customers on data & analytics ambitions and challenges. During the exploratory discussions with our (potential) customers, you will recognise their goals, bottlenecks, and needs. You translate them into a tangible solution using Power BI. You do much more than just creating dashboards.


In your role as a Power BI Consultant, you develop data models and analytics solutions on which our customers can make intelligent data-driven decisions. Of course, your solutions are beautiful, they work intuitively, and they provide the correct information. In addition to your technical skills, you also have an eye for the business that enables you to operate as a true advisor. You do not simply create what your customers ask for, but what they need. After all, it is your profession!


Your most important tasks as a Power BI Consultant:


  • You analyse the ambitions and challenges of our customers;
  • You develop good management information for your customers based on your analysis;
  • You develop robust data models and create effective visual appealing dashboards in Power BI;
  • You work with Microsoft Azure Technology and Power BI.


What does Rockfeather have to offer?


Rockfeather gives you the complete freedom to continue your development as a Power BI specialist or become a more all-around Data & Analytics Consultant. You want to give your experience an extra boost by using the latest technologies and not getting stuck in existing technology and with the same customers. The variety of ambitious customers and the latest technology are more the rule than the exception for us. Together we are passionate about the possibilities of data-driven working and offering the best solution for our customers. Our teams with Data Analytics, Data Integration, Data Science, and Low-code colleagues share their knowledge and network so that together we can realise impactful projects and unique solutions. We understand that the quality of your life determines the quality of your work. That is why we offer a complete package to take good care of yourself and your loved ones.

Just like every other company, we think we are unique, and we are 'the place to be.' The truth is that we are not 'the place to be' for a lot of people. If you are looking for a place to build a career in our 'management' or if you like everything clean and crisp between 9:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., then look somewhere else.


At Rockfeather, we put craftsmanship first. We are passionate about what we do; embracing technology to empower ambitious people. If you want all the freedom and support to develop your skills to become the next ‘data guru’, then Rockfeather is the place for you. We also offer the opportunity to buy shares of the team you work in, the ultimate way to bring your entrepreneurship to the next level!


Job requirements


What do you bring to the table?


  • You preferably have a completed Bachelor's degree. But in the end, your skills and attitude make the real difference.
  • You have a minimum of one year of experience with Power BI, and preferably also DAX and SQL;
  • You have proven experience with having helped to translate needs into robust data models;
  • You have knowledge of information analysis, KPI development and Data modelling;
  • Of course, you have good communication skills and a high level of customer and quality awareness;
  • You have the flexibility to work and maintain focus in an evolving environment;
  • You like to share knowledge with others, and you're a team player and networker;
  • You are result-driven and customer-oriented because you own the process and consistently deliver top-notch quality;
  • You like to roll up your sleeves, and you have a talent for spotting new opportunities.
  • You live in the Netherlands. We need you to be local. So NL Based only!

Title: Internship - Digital Data Science & Digital Analytics [6 months]

JOIN OUR AMSTERDAM DIGITAL DATA SCIENCE AND ANALYTICS TEAMS!

At adidas, we believe that data is one of the most important resources, that enables us to better understand our consumer, enhance their experience and connect them to their passion. TRADING EXCELLENCE - DATA SCIENCE: The Data Science team at adidas within Trading Excellence focuses on Forecasting and prize optimization leveraging advanced Machine Learning models to support buying, planning, and trading decisions. Analytics: Support the delivery of analytics services by assisting in areas like data collection, mining, and analysis to generate fact-based insights.
Project Contribution: Contribute to assigned projects, participating in tasks related to analytics implementation and database integration

Student of Business, Engineering, Data Analytics, Computer Sciences or equivalent
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills in combination with a strategic way of thinking
First experiences in project management beneficial
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Hands-on working style to get things done, ability to work under pressure to meet critical deadlines
Agile, open-minded team player with a passion for sports and lifestyle
Eagerness to continuously improve oneself and to further develop own skills
Fluent in English
Affinity to digital tools
Strong MS Office skills (especially PowerPoint and Excel)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python and PowerBI


What's In It For You


Employee discounts on products
Chances to attend and take part in on campus events and sponsored adidas events/games
Structured training and development, access to LinkedIn Learning, Language Training and adidas Learning Portal
Possibility to join our mentorship program, networking opportunities or employee resource groups
International intern community and work environment
Regular development conversations as part of your role
Inspiring campus with canteens, cafes, reflection rooms and sport facilities including an on-site gym (free)
Company events focusing on sports and mental health
Flexible and agile working arrangements (40% home office possible)
Monthly gross allowance: 1.200,00€


ELIGIBILITY


Enrolled as full-time student for the complete duration of the internship
Candidates in penultimate year of study preferred (following the internship, students should have maximum one year to graduate)
Availability for the full duration of the internship from September 2025 – March 2026
Local to Amsterdam/Ability to relocate to Amsterdam for the full duration of the internship

Application Deadline: March 1st, 2025, 11:59 PM CET
Start Date: September 1st, 2024

Location: adidas Headquarters in Amsterdam city

To apply to the role, please submit your CV. You don't have to write us a motivation letter, but if you have something to say, let us know.

Title: Data Analyst FinTech and Finance
Description:
How do you make our customers happy?

With 13.5 million customers, a catalog of 38 million products, and 48,000 partner sellers, the success of our financial processes hinges on exceptional sophistication and reliability. As Data Analyst FinTech and Finance, you’ll drive the transformation of complex financial data into clear, actionable insights that improve decision-making across our organization. Your analysis will directly impact how we optimize financial processes, improve partner experiences, and deliver additional customer value.

The biggest challenge

Developing and implementing scalable analytics solutions in an environment where traditional financial models converge with platform dynamics. The complexity of our operation – processing millions of transactions across multiple business models – demands very particular approaches to financial data analysis. You’ll need to combine technical precision with business acumen, transforming vast datasets into insights that demonstrably drive strategic decisions. And this role requires more than analytical excellence; you’ll also have to influence stakeholders and promote a data-driven culture across finance and business teams.

What You'll Do As Data Analyst FinTech And Finance

As a key member of the FinTech/Finance Data team, you’ll lead initiatives that define and enhance our financial data capabilities and promote data-driven decision-making. You’ll work closely with stakeholders across Finance, FinTech, and business teams to develop solutions that drive operational excellence and accelerate strategic growth.

Your primary focus will be designing and implementing automated analytics solutions that scale with our growing platform. From developing robust reconciliation frameworks to creating intuitive dashboards, you’ll ensure our financial reporting is accurate and actionable. You’ll also serve as a strategic advisor, helping teams understand and act on the financial implications of new propositions and process changes.

Responsibilities

Working closely with product teams and finance stakeholders, you’ll take ownership of end-to-end analytics projects. This includes conceptualizing solutions, building automated workflows, and implementing monitoring systems that ensure sustained value delivery. You’ll champion data-driven approaches, demonstrating through concrete results how analytics can and should improve business outcomes. Key responsibilities:


Design and implement scalable, automated financial analytics solutions
Develop comprehensive dashboards that provide deep insight into transaction flows
Create analytical frameworks that assist financial teams in commercial decision-making
Lead complex data initiatives from conception through successful implementation
Advise stakeholders on data-driven process optimizations
Build and maintain critical financial connections and reconciliation systems
Drive adoption of data-driven practices across finance and business teams


Why you can make a difference

You combine deep analytical expertise with a strong business sense and proven stakeholder management skills. With a relevant Master’s degree and at least 5 years of data analytics experience in finance, you have the theoretical foundation and practical expertise to drive immediate impact. Your technical skills span SQL, dashboard development, and data storytelling, and you take a systematic approach to problem-solving. You also know how to communicate your ideas convincingly, and collaborate with relevant business stakeholders to ensure your solutions generate long-term value.

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


Detail obsessed You get lost in striving for technical perfection at the expense of making business impact
Solo performer You prefer independent analysis to collaborative problem-solving
Status quo defender You're more comfortable managing existing processes than driving change
Strategic data leader combine technical mastery with business insight. That’s how you drive transformation
Impact accelerator You translate analytical insights into concrete actions that deliver measurable results
Collaborative thinker You thrive on building cross-functional partnerships that amplify your strategic value


Where you'll work

You’ll join our FinTech/Finance Data team at the heart of bol’s financial operations. Here, you’ll work with peers who combine analytical rigor with business pragmatism to drive retail tech platform growth. We take our analysis seriously, and our culture is welcoming and collaborative. Impact is a given: you’ll help shape how we leverage financial data to create better experiences for colleagues, partners, and millions of customers.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data Analyst - Growth
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst - Growth to join our dynamic Data Analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for providing key insights into customer acquisition, retention, and overall marketing performance. You will work closely with the marketing teams to understand user behavior, evaluate campaign effectiveness, and identify opportunities to optimize new customer growth and customer lifetime value. As a Data Analyst - Growth you will be part of an agile team of web analysts within our ecommerce department. Your role will involve working on a variety of projects—from large-scale initiatives to smaller projects and ad hoc analyses—ensuring quick turnaround times, to meet the rapid pace of ecommerce decision-making.

What you will do:


Perform analytics such as multi-touch attribution, churn analysis, and CLV modeling to gauge marketing channel efficiency, streamline budget allocation for upcoming campaigns, and support the development of future initiatives
Design, implement, and update marketing performance dashboards, reports, and KPIs to systematically track and evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and initiatives, ensuring alignment with strategic business objectives
Design and implement robust data collection processes to ensure high-quality data is gathered from various marketing channels, CRM systems, and customer interactions
Proactively take responsibility for project outcomes, team performance, and data insights, demonstrating accountability and driving continuous improvement
Communicate complex data insights clearly to (non-technical) audiences, collaborate seamlessly with cross-functional teams, and build strong relationships across the organization


Who you are:


5+ years of experience in web analytics, preferably within the ecommerce retail (fashion) industry
Deep understanding of LookML, SQL, data integrations, and ETL processes, with a proven ability to create accurate data models and insightful visualizations that meet business needs
Strong proficiency in integrating data from multiple sources into a Customer Data Platform (CDP) and leveraging Google Cloud Platform services, including BigQuery and GA4
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively present data insights to diverse stakeholders and document processes clearly
A collaborative mindset, demonstrated teamwork capabilities, and a commitment to maintaining a user-centric approach in all data-related initiatives


What you will get?


You’ll work with cutting-edge technology like LookML, Google Cloud Platform services and Segment (a world-class CPD)
We encourage you to develop yourself
You will be part of a highly motivated team of analytics professionals from all over the world
We’ll offer relocation services for a smooth landing

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

Tracking Events Design and Specification: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and specify tracking events that capture user behavior and product interactions

Product and Feature Usage Metrics and KPIs: Develop and monitor key metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance

Overall Product Growth Metrics and Analysis: Track and analyze overall product growth metrics to identify trends and opportunities
A/B Test Framework for Continuous Improvements: Implement and manage an A/B testing framework to facilitate data-driven experimentation and optimization
Hypothesis and Experiments Documentation, Delivery, and Analysis: Document hypotheses, design and execute experiments, and analyze results to validate assumptions and inform product decisions
Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Product Research: Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors
Use AI Tools and Approaches for Product Analysis: Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance product analysis and uncover valuable insights



Qualifications:


Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets
Product Development Knowledge: Familiarity with product development processes and methodologies
Technical Proficiency: Experience with data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Looker Data Studio, and product analytics platforms like Amplitude, Devtodev, Mixpanel, or other modern tools and frameworks
AI and Machine Learning Experience: Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their application in product analysis
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent experience

Communication

Knowledge of data visualization tools
Statistical modeling expertise

Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Rentman:

At Rentman we have developed a smart, powerful resource management and planning platform for the event and production industry. From small companies to high-end event service providers, businesses in over 70 countries use our software to realise festivals, concerts, corporate events, and more. For event service providers that encounter daily challenges with keeping track of inventory, scheduling staff or creating professional estimates in a highly dynamic industry, Rentman is the best solution. Check out our public roadmap to get an idea of features planned for development! Rentman has its HQ in Utrecht, Netherlands and our second office in Toronto, Canada.




Over the last 10 years, we have successfully grown into a business that employs nearly 100 professionals with 30 different nationalities. The average age of our colleagues is 30. Our internal communication is in English. Rentman has an open and inclusive culture with a flat hierarchy. We are curious, goal oriented, and take ownership. We love to challenge ideas for the better and help each other to be successful.




Mission Of This Role:

The mission of our Data Analyst is to help uncover stories our data can tell us. This position is not just about building new data products to serve our internal teams - you will have a significant role in building our data foundation. You will work closely with Arthur, our Data Engineer and a Data & Tooling Developer to grow and shape our data team.




If you’re passionate about making a difference, taking ownership and working together with a team that is curious and goal-oriented, then you might be our perfect fit.




What You’ll Do:

Develop and maintain data products to make data accessible and actionable for internal teams
Create insightful dashboards that tell meaningful stories through data
Enhance team processes and collaboration by contributing ideas for improvement
Train colleagues to improve data literacy and empower them to use data effectively in decision-making
Handle day-to-day data requests and proactively manage projects, ensuring timely delivery and effective communication of progress and blockers
Stay informed about and resolve data-related incidents or inaccuracies within the company
Assist in growing the team's capabilities and influence within the organization through innovative ideas and mentorship




What We’re Looking For:

Experience with BI tools and presenting complex data insights through visualizations and clear storytelling
Advanced SQL expertise, including creating efficient, complex queries
Understanding of data modeling principles and data warehouse concepts, including normalization, denormalization, and data lakes
Familiarity with statistics (regression, hypothesis testing)
Excellent English proficiency, written and spoken

Bonus Points For:

Experience with DBT and BigQuery
Basic understanding of Python
Experience working in a B2B SaaS environment
Passion and interest in Machine Learning and AI
Active engagement in mentoring colleagues to make better use of data tools
Experience in the event/media production industry is a big plus




Don't worry if you don't tick all the boxes, but let us know why you are the best for this role anyway




What Will You Get:

An ambitious, young, inclusive (and awesome) international team
A competitive salary up to €3,800 (+8% holiday benefit)
A “13th month” annual bonus based on company results
25 days of paid vacation
Flexible WFH policy & work from anywhere for 4 weeks a year
A shiny Windows, Linux or Mac of your choice
An Annual training budget to boost your skill
A pension plan via BrightPensioen
Sports activities (Rentman football team, squash and padel) and a Onefit fitness subscription
An OV Business card if you live further than 10km away from the office
A flexible and engaging work environment with free lunches, office perks (PS5, Ping Pong, D&D), legendary karaoke parties, and various team activities
A paid 4-week sabbatical after 5 years to go on an adventure
An amazing office in the heart of Utrecht, Netherlands, at the historical Drift 17




Our Process:

Excited? Because we are!

The more we get to know you and why you applied for this job, the better your chances.




The first interview is an introductory chat with our recruitment team to see if there is a potential match. If we both agree this is the case, you will meet the Hiring Manager, Arthur (Data Engineer). Next, you’ll have a chance to showcase your skills in an assessment. After the assessment, a third interview will follow with colleagues from the team you will join so you can get a great feel for the culture and values of Rentman.




Apply now by using the apply button! For questions or additional information, contact us at work@rentman.io




At Rentman, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We believe that our differences make us stronger and strive to foster a workplace where everyone feels valued and respected.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready to visualize data and drive insight? At YoungOnes, you'll play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights. We're looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about creating compelling dashboards and visualizations, as well as supporting various departments in optimizing their data utilization. Join our dynamic, fast-growing tech scale-up and help us shape the future of data-driven decision making. And most importantly, really create an impact in the company.




WHAT YOU'LL DO

YoungOnes is an ambitious tech platform that connects young talent with clients across the Netherlands, United Kingdom, and France. In this international environment, you’ll collaborate closely with both Dutch and English-speaking colleagues.

As a Data Analyst, your primary responsibility will be developing impactful dashboards and visualizations that transform data into easily digestible insights for various teams. In addition, you’ll actively engage with teams to understand and provide solutions to their everyday data needs, ensuring that data serves its purpose for continuous improvement.

You’ll join our Data team and work closely with colleagues across the organization. Your role will be instrumental in helping teams focus on what’s important through continuous analysis and timely delivery of insights, using data from the Azure stack alongside tools like Databricks, Databases and Power BI.




WHAT WE OFFER

A gross salary of €3,000 to €5,000 based on 40 hours per week (dependent on experience and skills).
25 vacation days, 6.5 ADV days, and 1 extra holiday per year.
A quarterly bonus (based on company performance).
8% holiday pay, pension scheme, and travel reimbursement (if living more than 10km from the office).
The chance to grow and develop within our international scale-up.
Resources and opportunities for personal development.
Attention to mental well-being, in partnership with OpenUp.
Great perks such as a €150 sports budget, daily fresh lunches, healthy snacks, biweekly get-togethers, our own festival, padel tournaments, and incentive trips like skiing.

HBO/WO level thinking and working capabilities.
0-3 years of experience in a relevant field.
Strong aptitude for creating data visualizations and dashboards.
Proficient in SQL & DAX.
Experience with Power BI.
Communicative and eager to learn.
Preferred Dutch speaker.
Passionate about using data to drive improvements.
Collaborative and supportive in team environments.
Willing to be in the Breda office 3 to 4 days a week.

Klaar om impact te maken met data? Ben jij die BI Consultant die de klantvraag weet te vertalen in technische oplossingen? Bij iqbs krijg je de kans om jouw BI-vaardigheden naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Als (all-round) BI Consultant werk je zelfstandig binnen projectteams en speel je een sleutelrol in het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van Power BI-dashboards, datamodellen en datawarehouses.




Dit mag je van ons verwachten

Je verdient tussen de €4.200 - €5.500. Ook kun je extra bonussen ontvangen, afhankelijk van jouw prestaties en die van de organisatie.
We faciliteren je in een werkplek waar je altijd en overal kan werken. Thuis, op kantoor in Bunnik of bij één van de andere bedrijven van Axelio. Zo voel je je overal thuis.
Wij stimuleren jou om in jezelf te investeren en jezelf te ontwikkelen. Per jaar investeren we 10 dagen die je kan inzetten voor studie & trainingen.
Wij bieden jou een mobiliteitsbudget dat je kan inzetten voor een leaseauto, een leasefiets, het openbaar vervoer of kan laten uitkeren als een bruto vergoeding.
Bij iqbs krijg je 28 vakantiedagen en heb je de mogelijkheid om extra dagen bij te kopen maar ook om dagen te verkopen. Flexibiliteit die past bij jouw situatie.
Jouw welzijn staat voorop. Met toegang tot psychologen, mindfulness sessies en zelfhulpmodules blijf je in balans, op het werk en daarbuiten.
Bij iqbs is werken meer dan jouw functie goed uitoefenen. We hechten veel waarde aan een goede sfeer en organiseren regelmatig gezellige borrels en teamuitjes.




Dit ga je doen als Medior BI Consultant

Als (all-round) BI Consultant bij iqbs werk je binnen projectteams voor klanten en voer je zelfstandig je werkzaamheden uit. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling én het onderhoud van Power BI-dashboards, datamodellen, datawarehouses en de bijbehorende ETL-processen om data uit bronsystemen te halen.

In deze rol vertaal je de wensen van de klant naar adviezen en passende oplossingen binnen de BI-omgeving. Je hebt kennis van datawarehouses en ETL-processen binnen het Microsoft Data Platform, waarbij je werkt met SQL, Data Factory, Databricks en Fabric. De meeste van onze BI-projecten zijn gebaseerd op data uit ERP-systemen, wat betekent dat je veelal te maken krijgt met data en rapportages over logistieke en financiële bedrijfsprocessen. Daarnaast neem je een junior collega op sleeptouw en begeleid je hem of haar bij het uitvoeren van projecten.




Jouw werkzaamheden:

Het analyseren van de informatiebehoefte van de klant.
Modelleren en ontwerpen van de benodigde datawarehouse-architectuur met onze eigen iqbs-tools.
Ontsluiten van verschillende gegevensbronnen naar het datawarehouse in Azure.
Ontwikkelen van dashboards en apps in Power BI.
Het ontwikkelen van de presentatielaag in SharePoint en rapportages met Microsoft BI-tools, zoals Power BI, Excel en Reporting Services.
Fungeren als ambassadeur op BI gebied binnen en buiten de organisatie en actief deelnemen aan kennisdeling binnen het iqbs-team.




Dit verwachten we van jou

Minimaal een hbo-opleiding in Informatica, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde of ICT.
Ervaring met rapporteren uit ERP-systemen, Power BI, Azure, Fabric, Power BI, SQL, Python.
Je bent een teamspeler met sterke analytische vaardigheden en een resultaatgerichte instelling.
Bereidheid om af en toe te reizen in binnen- en buitenland;
Certificaten in Microsoft BI stack of bereidheid om deze te behalen.
Creativiteit in het vinden van de beste oplossing voor de klant.
Uitstekende beheersing van zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.




Over iqbs

Met meer dan 15 jaar ervaring hebben we uitgebreide kennis opgebouwd in het ontsluiten van ERP-systemen, het ontwikkelen van een eigen datawarehouse en het bouwen van dashboards. Dit wordt allemaal ondersteund door automatiseringen binnen ons eigen framework. Iqbs heeft uitgebreide ervaring met het toegankelijk maken van data uit ERP-systemen zoals Business Central, Infor, SAP en Odoo. Bovendien bieden wij organisaties ondersteuning met trainingen en het beantwoorden van specifieke vragen, zoals het ontsluiten van data uit verschillende bronnen.




Je gaat aan de slag in een team van professionals, die elke dag werken om leads en klanten mee te nemen in de kansen die Data Analytics, Business Intelligence en Cloud hen bieden. Bedrijven en mensen die aan de slag willen met Power BI komen veelal via een korte online zoektocht bij ons uit. Het is aan jou om door goede kwalificatie van de leads die projecten te spotten waar de complexere datavraagstukken liggen. Dat is waar we goed in zijn, dat is waar we blij van worden.




Als onderdeel van Axelio profiteer je van alle kansen die het werken bij een groep biedt.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You search for valuable insights in the existing data, and implement new sensors that will improve those functionalities.

As a Data Analyst, you gather and analyse data from the exoskeleton to learn from its errors. You ensure that the exoskeleton generates readable data and you help your teammates make design choices using the data of previous years. Besides that you help with all things data, like processing data from the depth camera or EEG, and you develop software together with the control and software engineers. Do you have a desire to translate abstract data into a concrete solution? Then the Data Analyst function is for you!

What You Will Do As Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst you will develop software focused on data from the exoskeleton. This includes processing point clouds from the depth cameras, classifying the EEG-data together with the HMI engineer, modeling the exoskeleton based on IMU and joint encoder data, and more. You write scripts to analyse data from previous years to help your teammates find the required specifications of, for example, a new motor. Furthermore, you monitor the exoskeleton during training by keeping track of all the live sensor data. There is also plenty of room to add new things, such as new sensors. All to eventually analyze the data and be able to draw conclusions on what could make the exoskeleton even more efficient, faster, more reliable and smarter!

You recognize yourself in


You have an affinity for programming and have some experience with either Python or C++.
You want to know the cause of failures and find solutions to prevent these from happening.
You enjoy cooperating with people from different disciplines.
You can find the best way to clarify or visualize data to those who have less knowledge of the data.
You enjoy searching for patterns in data.
You are curious to know what is not yet measured.


You want to become (even) better at


The collection, saving, processing and analysis of large amounts of data.
Programming for data analysis (Python), but also embedded programming (C++).
Working as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Working with deadlines and owning responsibility to your team members.
Working independently within a team, setting your own deadlines.


You get in return


Technical and personal skills.
Experience in working together in a large multi-disciplinary team.
Contacts with companies in the data analytics industry.
The space to make mistakes and learn from them.
A year full of unforgettable memories and new friends.

Title: Data Analytics - Trading
Description:
We are partnering with a prestigious international bank to find a skilled Market Data Analytics Analyst for their Risk Management department. This is a key role in managing market data across areas like market risk, product control, and counterparty credit risk, supporting critical decision-making and regulatory compliance.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and Maintain market data and proxy models for various asset classes.
Analyse and Report on large data sets to drive insights and improve decision-making.
Implement market data for market risk initiatives and regulatory changes.
Collaborate with Stakeholders including Trading, Risk, and Model Validation teams to resolve market data queries.
Coordinate Projects with IT and support teams to maintain high data quality standards.
Validate and Report on market data daily, ensuring compliance with internal policies.




Qualifications & Experience:

Essential:




A graduate degree in Finance, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or Quantitative Field, CQF
3+ years of experience in Market Risk or Product Control within a large, global financial institution.
Proficient in SQL and Python, with experience analysing large market data sets.
Strong understanding of market risk metrics (e.g., VaR, HVaR, IRC).
Fluent in English, with excellent communication skills.




Desirable:




Professional qualifications (e.g., PRM, FRM).
Experience with financial systems like Summit, Murex, Reuters or ActivePivot.
Interest in financial market regulations.




Personal Competencies:




Proactive with strong problem-solving and organizational skills.
Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Outside the box thinking, can think on your feet
Excellent collaboration skills, able to engage with stakeholders at all levels.

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is een vooruitstrevend internationaal managementadviesbureau. We bieden een unieke mix van AI- en consultancy, waardoor traditioneel advies wordt verrijkt om superieure waarde te leveren aan onze klanten. Met 2200 consultants in 18 landen en expertise in meer dan 30 sectoren en diensten, optimaliseren we klantprojecten wereldwijd. Met onze Consulting for Good-aanpak lopen wij voorop in de markt en streven we naar impact door innovatieve Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)-oplossingen, waardoor duurzaamheid een hefboom is voor winstgevende transformatie.



Sia Nederland
In 2009 werd het kantoor in Amsterdam geopend, dat nu in de Rembrandttoren is gevestigd met een geweldig uitzicht vanaf de 28e verdieping op Amsterdam. We hebben een grote klantenportefeuille opgebouwd in met name de energie- en financiële dienstverlening, maar ook daarbuiten. Samen met de andere sectoroverstijgende diensten (HR, Change Management en Marketing & Customer Experience) creëert ons Amsterdam Data Science Center of Excellence waarde door gebruik te maken van advanced analytics en door het creëren van innovatieve AI-producten. We hechten niet alleen waarde aan onze klanten, maar investeren ook in onze consultants. We bevorderen een inclusieve werkplek voor onze medewerkers, ongeacht hun achtergrond, genderidentiteit of overtuiging. Elke medewerker is opgenomen in onze strategie en de manier waarop we zakendoen. Bij Sia ben je als medewerker belangrijk!






Job Description



Met wie ga je werken
Het Amsterdamse Data Science team is jong, divers en groeiend (10+). Je komt te werken in een team dat je uitdaagt en investeert in jouw professionele ontwikkeling. We hebben een platte structuur en vertrouwen op de ondernemersgeest van onze collega’s. Initiatief nemen wordt sterk aangemoedigd. We streven naar welzijn, diversiteit en kennisdeling binnen het team, zodat we samen kunnen groeien.



Wat ga je doen
Als Data & Analytics Consultant werk je samen met onze Data Scientists, Data Engineers en andere consultants van Sia Global, aan diverse klantprojecten in multidisciplinaire teams. Je gebruikt je analytische mindset en datavaardigheden om complexe bedrijfsproblemen op te lossen en bruikbare inzichten te leveren.
Verantwoordelijkheden zijn onder meer:



Nauw samenwerken met SIA consultants op opdrachten met een analytische uitdaging
Bedrijfsproblemen identificeren door inzichten uit gegevens te extraheren, te interpreteren en uit te leggen
Ontwikkelen van statistische- en analysemethoden om specifieke operationele problemen op te lossen
Ervoor zorgen dat de diepgaande inzichten die worden gegenereerd uit geavanceerde analyses zich vertalen in bedrijfsimpact
Presenteren van resultaten en houden van workshops bij klanten

Wie je bent



Je wilt bedrijfsimpact hebben, niet alleen door data-analyse te doen, maar ook door aanbevelingen te doen door middel van inspirerende presentaties
Je hebt het vermogen om je snel aan te passen en te werken op verschillende bedrijfsgebieden binnen een uitdagende omgeving
Je beschikt over uitzonderlijke analytische en kwantitatieve probleemoplossende vaardigheden
Je hebt het vermogen om samen te werken in een teamomgeving
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en kunt ingewikkelde concepten op een synthetische manier presenteren
Je hebt een goede staat van dienst op het gebied van leiderschap in een academische, professionele of extracuriculaire setting



Qualifications



Wat heb je nodig



Afgeronde WO Masteropleiding in Statistiek, Econometrie, Economie, Business Analytics of een gerelateerd studiegebied.
Je hebt al enkele jaren ervaring in een soortgelijke functie.
Goede vaardigheden in Python en minimaal een andere analytische taal (bijv. R, SQL)
Ervaring met datavisualisatie en rapportage (bijv. Tableau, Power BI)
Kennis van Machine Learning technieken of optimalisatie is een sterk pluspunt
Vloeiend in Engels en Nederlands, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling. Extra talen zijn een sterk pluspunt.

Wat wij bieden



Opleidingsmogelijkheden om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen
Mogelijkheden om aan internationale opdrachten te werken
Flexibele werktijden
Een meritocratische benadering van promotie
Prestatiegerelateerde bonus
Een aantrekkelijk pakket (leaseauto, ziektekostenverzekering, pensioenregeling)



Additional Information



Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted

Title: Analytics Expert
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We’re looking for a Analytics Expert at Randstad Global

Diemen - Netherlands, hybrid, fulltime




BR&AF

The business risk and audit function (BR&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Group’s (risk) management, control and governance practices.
